packet

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • packet.Packet

  • public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    Packet handles the storage of data to be sent to the servers clients and conversion of data into and from bytes.
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Joshua Preece

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Packet(byte[] receivedPacket)
      Creates a new Packet from a byte array.
      Packet(int id, PacketHeaders header, Question questions)
      Creates a new Packet with a client id, header/data type and Question object which contains the questions.
      Packet(int id, PacketHeaders header, java.lang.String msg)
      Creates a new Packet with the client id, header/data type and a single string message.
      Packet(int id, PacketHeaders header, java.lang.String[] results)
      Creates a new Packet with a client id, header/data type and a string array of results.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] convertToByteArray(java.lang.String[] questions)
      Converts each element within a string array into bytes.
      byte[] convertToByteArray(java.lang.String[][] questions)
      Converts each element within a 2D string array into bytes.
      java.lang.String getData()
      Returns the data stored within this packet excluding id and header
      byte[] getDataForTransmit()
      Retrieves the packet as a byte array.
      int getHeader()
      Returns the header of this packet
      int getID()
      Returns the client id assigned to this packet
      java.lang.String[] returnDataArray() 
      void splitBytes(byte[] data)
      Splits a byte array into separate byte arrays.
      java.lang.String trim(byte[] data)
      Removes all empty bytes from a byte array

        public Packet(byte[] receivedPacket)
        Creates a new Packet from a byte array.

      • Packet

        public Packet(int id,
      PacketHeaders header,
      java.lang.String msg)
        Creates a new Packet with the client id, header/data type and a single string message.
        Parameters:
        id - assigned to a packet to identify the sender
        header - used to identify the type of data being sent
        msg - a single string message

      • Packet

        public Packet(int id,
      PacketHeaders header,
      Question questions)
        Creates a new Packet with a client id, header/data type and Question object which contains the questions.
        Parameters:
        id - assigned to the packet to identify the sender
        header - used to identify the type of data being sent
        questions - a Question object which contains a string array of questions

      • Packet

        public Packet(int id,
      PacketHeaders header,
      java.lang.String[] results)
        Creates a new Packet with a client id, header/data type and a string array of results.
        Parameters:
        id - assigned to the packet to identify the sender
        header - used to identify the type of data being sent
        results - a String array of results
